0: Illustris is significant not just because it looks cool, but also because it is the first model to accurately predict the gas and metal content we see in the universe, as well as the variety of different types of galaxies we observe through our telescopes. It is so accurate, in fact, that a mock observation of galaxies from the Illustris model could pass for an image taken by the Hubble Ultra Deep Field Space Telescope.
